item.title: A Tempting Trio of Modern Dance
item.author: Jiaqi Shi,
item.description: In front of a warm, receptive crowd, last Friday saw the opening of an exciting programme at the Royal Opera House, including a new ballet by Liam Scarlett, choreographed to Bernstein’s Symphony no. 2, The Age of Anxiety. This beautiful adaptation is based on the synonymous poem by W.H. Auden, …

item.title: Undercover at an auction
item.author: Jiaqi Shi,
item.description: I’ve always been intrigued by the mystery which surrounds the highly opulent-looking establishment that is Christie’s in South Kensington, never more so than when I traversed past it in my first year as a fresher on the route to campus from Evelyn Gardens. When one of its most recent sales came up …
